com.example.jacob.mybrary

Class ConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.jacob.mybrary.ConnectionManager

  • public class ConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Dominic on 2015-10-31. Low level http manager. Allows json objects to be put and retrieved from the server at a specific path. The path should not have a leading slash and should include the id at the end when appropriate.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkNetwork(android.content.Context context)
      This method should be called before any other network functionality should be used.
      java.lang.String get(java.lang.String path)
      Retrieves the object from the server at the given location.
      static ConnectionManager getInstance()
      Gets the instance of the connection manager.
      java.lang.String put(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String json)
      Sends a post request to the server with the given data.
      java.lang.String query(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String query)
      Searches the given location based on the given query.
      java.lang.String remove(java.lang.String path)
      Removes a given object from the server.

                   java.lang.String json)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a post request to the server with the given data.
        Parameters:
        path - Location on the server for the object to be stored.
        json - Json representation of the object to be stored.
        Returns:
        Returns a string containing the result of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occured during the transmission

                       throws java.io.IOException
        Searches the given location based on the given query.
        Parameters:
        path - Location on the server to be searched.
        query - Json query to be sent to the server.

      • remove

        public java.lang.String remove(java.lang.String path)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Removes a given object from the server. CAUTION: USE THIS CAREFULLY, IT IS POSSIBLE TO DELETE AN ENTIRE FOLDER.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of the object to be deleted.
        Returns:
        Returns a string containing the result of the operation.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occured during the transmission.

      • checkNetwork

        public boolean checkNetwork(android.content.Context context)
        This method should be called before any other network functionality should be used. Source: http://developer.android.com/training/basics/network-ops/connecting.html
        Parameters:
        context - Context of the app
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean indicating whether a network connection exists.
